summary: This is a deferred prosecution agreement between the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York and Tova Noel, a former Bureau of Prisons employee. Noel was indicted for falsifying count and round slips at the Metropolitan Correctional Center in August 2019, where Jeffrey Epstein was held. The agreement defers prosecution for six months if Noel complies with conditions including community service and cooperation with investigations.

events.title: Grand Jury Indictment of Tova Noel
events.description: A grand jury returns a six-count indictment charging Tova Noel with conspiracy and making false documents.

events.title: False Count Slips at MCC
events.description: Tova Noel admits to willfully completing materially false count and round slips in the Special Housing Unit of the Metropolitan Correctional Center.

locations: Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC), Special Housing Unit
keyFacts: Tova Noel, a Bureau of Prisons employee, was charged with falsifying count and round slips in the MCC's Special Housing Unit on August 9-10, 2019.
The deferred prosecution agreement requires Noel to complete 100 hours of community service and cooperate fully with investigations by the USAO-SDNY, FBI, and DOJ-OIG.
Noel admits to willfully and knowingly completing materially false documents regarding required counts and rounds at the MCC.
The agreement is for a six-month period, after which the government will move to dismiss the indictment if Noel complies with all conditions.
The document reveals ongoing investigations into misconduct at the Metropolitan Correctional Center where Jeffrey Epstein was held before his death.
